channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Ukraine has developed long-range weapon, Zelensky says
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky announced Thursday that his country has developed a long-range weapon that can hit targets up to 400 miles away, signaling potential responsibility for a strike on a Russian airport near Estonia on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Nick Robertson, The Hill

item.title: Russia's Putin and Turkey's Erdogan set to meet amid efforts to repair Ukraine grain deal
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will host Turkish leader Recep Tayyip Erdogan for talks next week, the Kremlin announced Friday, just over six weeks after Moscow broke off a deal brokered by Ankara and the U.N. that allowed Ukrainian grain to reach world markets safely despite the 18-month war.
item.dc:creator: AP, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Russia's Putin and Turkey's Erdogan set to meet amid efforts to repair Ukraine grain deal
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will host Turkish leader Recep Tayyip Erdogan for talks next week, the Kremlin announced Friday, just over six weeks after Moscow broke off a deal brokered by Ankara and the U.N. that allowed Ukrainian grain to reach world markets safely despite the 18-month war.
item.dc:creator: AP, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Gabon's opposition candidate alleges the ousted president's family is behind a plot to retain power
item.description: DAKAR, Senegal (AP) — Gabon’s opposition leader accused the family of the recently ousted president of engineering his removal from power in order to retain their control in the oil-rich Central African nation.
item.dc:creator: SAM MEDNICK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Gabon's opposition candidate alleges the ousted president's family is behind a plot to retain power
item.description: DAKAR, Senegal (AP) — Gabon’s opposition leader accused the family of the recently ousted president of engineering his removal from power in order to retain their control in the oil-rich Central African nation.
item.dc:creator: SAM MEDNICK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Greece: Firefighters rescue 25 migrants trapped in forest as massive wildfire approached
item.description: ATHENS, Greece (AP) — Greek firefighters rescued a group of 25 migrants trapped in a forest in northeastern Greece Friday as flames from a massive wildfire burning for two weeks approached, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: ELENA BECATOROS, COSTAS KANTOURIS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Greece: Firefighters rescue 25 migrants trapped in forest as massive wildfire approached
item.description: ATHENS, Greece (AP) — Greek firefighters rescued a group of 25 migrants trapped in a forest in northeastern Greece Friday as flames from a massive wildfire burning for two weeks approached, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: ELENA BECATOROS, COSTAS KANTOURIS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Pope arrives on first visit to Mongolia as Vatican relations with Russia and China remain strained
item.description: ULAANBAATAR, Mongolia (AP) — Pope Francis arrived in Mongolia on Friday morning to encourage one of the world’s smallest and newest Catholic communities.
item.dc:creator: NICOLE WINFIELD and SARUUL ENKHBOLD, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Emergency services leave South Africa fire scene. Now comes the grisly task of identifying bodies
item.description: JOHANNESBURG (AP) — Emergency services teams have left the scene of one of South Africa's deadliest inner-city fires and pathologists faced the grisly task Friday of identifying dozens of charred bodies and some body parts that have been transported to several mortuaries across the city of Johannesb
item.dc:creator: GERALD IMRAY and MOGOMOTSI MAGOME, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Ramaswamy isolates himself on Ukraine with proposed Putin pact
item.description: When the Fox News hosts asked the eight Republican presidential candidates on the debate stage last week who would not support continued funding for Ukraine, only Vivek Ramaswamy raised his hand.
item.dc:creator: Brad Dress, The Hill

item.title: A 98-year-old German man is charged as an accessory to murder at a Nazi concentration camp
item.description: German prosecutors say a 98-year-old man has been charged with being an accessory to murder as a guard at the Nazis’ Sachsenhausen concentration camp between 1943 and 1945.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Nobel body reverses invitation policy. Russia, Belarus, Iran and far-right leader are welcome
item.description: The foundation that administers the prestigious Nobel prizes has reversed its policy and invited Russia, Belarus and Iran, as well as a far-right Swedish politician, who all were previously banned.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Israel unveils 'most advanced' surveillance plane with AI-powered sensors: 'Unprecedented'
item.description: The new "Oron" surveillance aircraft will create real-time analysis and recommendations based on the vast amount of information the plane records through its array of sensors.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: China's Xi set to snub G20, dashing chance of Biden meeting: reports
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will likely skip next week's summit of G20 leaders in India, according to multiple reports, a development that would sink the chances of him meeting with President Biden.
item.dc:creator: Joe Jacquez, The Hill

item.title: China's Xi set to snub G20, dashing chance of Biden meeting: reports
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will likely skip next week's summit of G20 leaders in India, according to multiple reports, a development that would sink the chances of him meeting with President Biden.
item.dc:creator: Joe Jacquez, The Hill

item.title: US military urges halt to clashes in eastern Syria amid concerns of ISIS resurgence
item.description: The United States military called to halt the ongoing clashes between rival U.S.-backed factions in Syria, saying the violence could lead to the resurgence of the Islamic State group.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US military urges halt to clashes in eastern Syria amid concerns of ISIS resurgence
item.description: The United States military called to halt the ongoing clashes between rival U.S.-backed factions in Syria, saying the violence could lead to the resurgence of the Islamic State group.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Chinese cities introduce measures to boost real estate sector
item.description: Prominent Chinese urban centers have unveiled plans to extend preferential loan opportunities for prospective first-time homebuyers, irrespective of their credit history.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Ukraine Defense Ministry asks for 'ammunition, not advice' in new video
item.description: The Ukraine Defense Ministry asked for “ammunition, not advice” in a new video Thursday, following recent criticism from U.S. officials over Kyiv’s strategy amid a slow-moving counteroffensive.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, The Hill

item.title: Australia introduces law empowering gig workers to negotiate minimum pay and conditions
item.description: Australia's center-left Labor government will introduce a law this week granting gig workers the ability to negotiate for minimum pay and essential conditions.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Australia introduces law empowering gig workers to negotiate minimum pay and conditions
item.description: Australia's center-left Labor government will introduce a law this week granting gig workers the ability to negotiate for minimum pay and essential conditions.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Uber launches electric bike service in Kenya, aiming for emissions-free platform by 2040
item.description: Uber introduced an electric motorbike service in Kenya, marking its first initiative in Africa as part of the company's global commitment to achieve emissions-free operations by 2040.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Video appears to show Prigozhin dismissing security concerns days before fatal plane crash
item.description: A newly released video appears to show former Wagner Group leader Yevgeny Prigozhin brushing off concerns that there were threats to his life days before he was killed in a plane crash.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Scully, The Hill

item.title: Mutineers in Gabon appoint a military leader after detaining the president, alleging corruption
item.description: LIBREVILLE, Gabon (AP) — Mutinous soldiers in Gabon proclaimed their republican guard chief as the country’s leader Wednesday after placing the just-reelected President Ali Bongo Ondimba under house arrest, alleging betrayal and massive embezzlement during his long-time rule over the oil-rich Centra
item.dc:creator: YVES LAURENT GOMA and SAM MEDNICK, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Ukrainian drones strike deep in Russian territory, Moscow says, while a barrage in Kyiv kills 2
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine sent waves of drones deep into western Russia in more than four hours of nighttime attacks that struck military assets, Russian officials and media reports said Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: SUSIE BLANN and DASHA LITVINOVA, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Canada warns residents visiting US about anti-LGBTQ laws
item.description: The Canadian government said LGBTQ Canadians considering a trip to the U.S. should “check relevant state and local laws” before visiting.
item.dc:creator: Brooke Migdon, NewsNation

item.title: Japanese ministers eat Fukushima fish to show it's safe after nuclear plant wastewater is discharged
item.description: TOKYO (AP) — Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and three Cabinet ministers ate Fukushima fish sashimi at a lunch meeting Wednesday, in an apparent effort to show that fish is safe following the release of treated radioactive wastewater from the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant that began las
item.dc:creator: MARI YAMAGUCHI, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Japanese ministers eat Fukushima fish to show it's safe after nuclear plant wastewater is discharged
item.description: TOKYO (AP) — Japan's Prime Minister Fumio Kishida and three Cabinet ministers ate Fukushima fish sashimi at a lunch meeting Wednesday, in an apparent effort to show that fish is safe following the release of treated radioactive wastewater from the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant that began las
item.dc:creator: MARI YAMAGUCHI, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: White House says Putin and Kim Jong Un traded letters as Russia looks for munitions from North Korea
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The White House on Wednesday said that it has new intelligence that shows Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un have swapped letters as Russia looks to North Korea for munitions for the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Russian mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin is buried in private, ending his tumultuous journey
item.description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia (AP) — A private burial was held for Yevgeny Prigozhin, ending a tumultuous journey from St.
item.dc:creator: AP, NewsNation

item.title: Neurosurgeon investigating patient's mystery symptoms plucks worm from woman's brain
item.description: A neurosurgeon investigating a woman’s mystery symptoms in an Australian hospital says she plucked a wriggling worm from the patient’s brain.
item.dc:creator: ROD McGUIRK Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: US Marines killed in Australian aircraft crash were from Illinois, Virginia and Colorado
item.description: CANBERRA, Australia (AP) — The three U.S. Marines killed in a tiltrotor aircraft crash during a training exercise in Australia were from Illinois, Virginia and Colorado and another Marine was in critical condition, the Marine Corps said Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: US, Chinese commerce leaders meet: 'Huge progress'
item.description: Following a meeting in Beijing Monday, commerce leaders promised to improve communication between the United States and China, a signal that tensions could be easing.
item.dc:creator: Raquel Martin, WGN 9

item.title: British bog snorkeling championship contenders race through slime
item.description: Intrepid athletes donned snorkels and slithered through slime on Sunday during one of Britain’s quirkiest sporting events: the World Bog Snorkeling Championships.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: British bog snorkeling championship contenders race through slime
item.description: Intrepid athletes donned snorkels and slithered through slime on Sunday during one of Britain’s quirkiest sporting events: the World Bog Snorkeling Championships.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Virginia man stolen at birth meets Chilean family for first time
item.description: A 42-year-old Virginia man got to embrace his birth mother for the first time during a long-awaited family reunion in Valdivia, Chile.
item.dc:creator: Taylor Delandro, NewsNation

item.title: With drones and webcams, volunteer hunters join new search for mythical Loch Ness Monster
item.description: Mystery hunters converged on a Scottish lake on Saturday to look for signs of the mythical Loch Ness Monster.
item.dc:creator: Jill Lawless, WFLA, NBC
